Steps to reproduce:

I did nothing special on my system or within Thunderbird or Lightning. My Macbook Pro is set up as a US-based system. Lightning (embedded in Thunderbird) shows hours of the day in 12 hour format, as expected, along the left side of the calendar display. However, when creating a "New Event", the dialog uses 24 hour format.


Actual results:

New Event dialog uses 24 hour format even though the 12 hour format is (correctly) selected elsewhere.


Expected results:

New Event dialog should consistently use the same time format as elsewhere.

I am also experiencing this bug on Mac OS X 10.8.5. My system time format is 12-hour, and Thunderbird/Lightning calendar view/right side bar displays 12-hour, but the time field/time picker in the create/edit event window displays 24-hour format.

The time picker was fixed in Lightning 3.0 with Bug 255668 and I can confirm that it shows 12 hour format using Lightning 4.8a1 on Windows 7.

Looking at the source code Lightning seems to parse time format to detect if 12 or 24 hour format should be used:
https://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/calendar/resources/content/datetimepickers/datetimepickers.xml#1825

Maybe you are using a time format that is different from expected format?
Or maybe you are using additional extensions that break Lightning?

(In reply to Decathlon from comment #11)
> Sorry, could you also try to enter this in the Error console:
> 
> var a = new Date(); a.toLocaleFormat("%X");

Ok, I just tried this and received the incorrect time format (missing the AM/PM) indicator.  However, I looked up the toLocaleFormat() method online and found this:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleFormat

"This feature is non-standard and is not on a standards track. Do not use it on production sites facing the Web: it will not work for every user. There may also be large incompatibilities between implementations and the behavior may change in the future."

So, I conducted an experiment by running:

var a = new Date(); a.toLocaleTimeString();

and got the correct time format:

11:53:00 AM

I'll attach a screen shot of this output.
